{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3558062,"name":"Jeff","username":"Khyros","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d26b3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-16T02:31:45.628Z","cooked":"

Hi guys, long time lurker, but this time I just can’t seem to find the answer. After struggling with aligning our bot to shoot onto the coral, we’ve decided we need to do some sort of vision system. We’ve never done it before, but we do have a Pixy2 camera from a few years ago.

Looking through various previous topics (Trying to get Pixy2 to work with Vscode java and Pixy2 Object recognition - #8 by 7674Software primarily, along with documentation) it seems we need to be updating our gradle to call in the pixy2.

I am not a programmer by trade, so I’m doing a lot of copy/paste and iterating until it works, but it seems like all of those examples are referring to older versions of gradle, as I can’t seem to get my build.gradle to compile with any of those alterations.

So, my question to the brain collective, 1) is there a simple update that I can implement? or 2) I downloaded the API from the PseudoResonance github for 1.4.1, but I don’t know what to do with the pixy2-java-api.jar. Do I just place it in the root folder, or do I have to call it or import it or something?

And then I guess finally, if all we’re using it for is to align the bot to the reef, and I completely overthinking this? All I’m looking to get are X,Y distances from the reef out of it, and really from that, I’m just looking for X - Y would be able to tell us how far from the reef we are, but I’m not sure how helpful that information is. I’m envisioning it working as our driver gets close and then runs the command to move the bot to a position relative to the reef, and then score, so I’m not even sure I need that much information out of it.
